化石讲述了人类之前居住在北美的最后一种灵长类动物的故事

Science X2023-11-08

Now, paleontologists from the University of Kansas and the Institute of Vertebrate Paleontology and Paleoanthropology in Beijing have published evidence in the Journal of Human Evolution shedding light on the long-standing saga of Ekgmowechashala, based on fossil teeth and jaws found in both Nebraska and China.

现在，来自堪萨斯大学和北京古脊椎动物与古人类学研究所的古生物学家在《人类进化杂志》上发表了证据，基于内布拉斯加州和中国发现的牙齿和颌骨化石，揭示了埃克莫韦查沙拉长期存在的传奇故事。 。

The story of Ekgmowechashala, the final primate to inhabit North America before Homo sapiens or Clovis people, reads like a spaghetti Western: A grizzled and mysterious loner, against the odds, ekes out an existence on the American Plains.

艾克莫韦查萨拉是智人或克洛维斯人之前居住在北美的最后一种灵长类动物，它的故事读起来就像意大利西部片：一个头发花白、神秘的孤独者，克服困难，在美国平原上勉强生存。

Except this tale unfolded about 30 million years ago, just after the Eocene-Oligocene transition during which North America saw great cooling and drying, making the continent less hospitable to warmth-loving primates.

不过这个故事发生在大约三千万年前，就在始新世-渐新世过渡之后，北美出现了严重的变冷和干燥，使得这片大陆不太适合喜温暖的灵长类动物。

Now, paleontologists from the University of Kansas and the Institute of Vertebrate Paleontology and Paleoanthropology in Beijing have published evidence in the Journal of Human Evolution shedding light on the long-standing saga of Ekgmowechashala, based on fossil teeth and jaws found in both Nebraska and China.

现在，来自堪萨斯大学和北京古脊椎动物与古人类学研究所的古生物学家在《人类进化杂志》上发表了证据，基于内布拉斯加州和中国发现的牙齿和颌骨化石，揭示了埃克莫韦查沙拉长期存在的传奇故事。 。

To do so, the researchers first had to reconstruct its family tree, a job helped by the discovery of an even more ancient Chinese "sister taxon" of Ekgmowechashala the team has named Palaeohodites (or "ancient wanderer").

为此，研究人员首先必须重建其家谱，这项工作得益于发现了更古老的中国 Ekgmowechashala“姐妹类群”，该团队将其命名为 Palaeohodites（或“古代流浪者”）。

The Chinese fossil discovery resolves the mystery of Ekgmowechashala's presence in North America, showing it was an immigrant rather than the product of local evolution.

中国化石的发现解开了埃克莫韦查沙拉在北美的存在之谜，表明它是一种移民，而不是当地进化的产物。

用户于2023-11-08保存本页面，原文版权归源站点所有。 -- 沉浸式翻译
